trial_identification.studytitle: A Multiple Ascending Dose Study of CSL112 in Healthy Volunteers
trial_identification.scientifictitle: An Adaptive, Phase I, Randomised, Placebo-controlled, Sponsor-unblinded, Multiple Ascending Dose Study to Investigate the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of Intravenous CSL112 in Healthy Volunteers

interventions.interventions:
Other interventions - CSL112 Other interventions - Placebo
Experimental: CSL112 - Multiple ascending intravenous doses of CSL112
Placebo Comparator: Placebo - Multiple intravenous infusions of placebo
Other interventions: CSL112 reconstituted high density lipoprotein
Other interventions: Placebo Normal saline (0.9%)

primaryOutcome.outcome: The frequency of drug-related adverse events
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 6 days after each infusion

primaryOutcome.outcome: The frequency of redness and swelling at the infusion site
primaryOutcome.timepoint: up to 24 hours after each infusion

primaryOutcome.outcome: Clinically important elevation of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) or aspartate aminotransferase (AST)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: up to 6 days after each infusion

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Pharmacokinetic profile of apoA-I after multiple intravenous infusions
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: up to 7 days after each infusion

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Healthy males and females aged 18 years to less than 55 years
- Body weight 50kg or greater
- Body mass index (BMI) between 18 and 42.0 kg/m2
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Evidence of a clinically significant medical condition, disorder or disease
- Evidence of hepatobiliary disease
- Any clinically relevant abnormal laboratory test result
- Evidence or history of alcohol or substance abuse

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of CSL112 in healthy volunteers after multiple infusions.
